Reviews.Title: “Very nice but far from "real" Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MorganRidler
Reviews.Content: The staff and room of the hotel was very nice, with soft pillows and sheets, and a big room with many helpful features. The pool was lovely and lobby is bright and elegant. But I booked this hotel on Priceline and I can see why they have rooms available, the location is not ideal. This is a great hotel for the business traveler or the conference goer but the average tourist will find it isolated from anything interesting to do. It is very close to many art museums but the only restaurants nearby are in the Sony Center, the Times Square of Berlin, or a drab neighborhood to the south.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jmax291
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline using the name-your-own-price feature. I've used this to book great stays in San Francisco, Las Vegas, Basel (Switzerland) and had wonderful experiences. Sometimes you get a sense that the hotel staff at reception knows you're not paying full price and might not give you the best service, but never have I had such a negative, shall we say struggle, with the front desk staff. Upon check-in, I informed the staff that I would be joined by a friend later, to which they responded that my booking was only for single occupancy. The first gentleman I dealt with was actually quite kind and suggested he would let it slip, but that there might only be one bed in the room. Indeed, there was only one bed--not queen-sized, only large enough for one person. I went back to reception and said I would be glad to pay the extra, but that it confused me because I thought I had booked for double occupancy. In fact, Priceline bookings are always noted for double occupancy, but they told me I would need to pay 20 EUR extra per night. This might be reasonable if the rate included breakfast, but it did not. I called Priceline at my own long-distance expense and they said they would look into it and get back to me within 5 days. As it was Easter weekend and I did not hear back from Priceline before my check-out, I had to talk to the reception staff repeatedly and only at check-out did they actually rescind the 20 EUR per night fee. The night before check-out, I asked if they might comp breakfast the next morning because of the trouble and nuisance the situation had caused. I thought it a reasonable request, but it was flat out denied. THAT SAID... the hotel is rather beautiful, posh, and comfortable. It has a small fitness facility including a tanning bed for 5 EUR/10 minutes. It's a bit of a walk (10-15 minutes) from the nearest U- and S-Bahn station at Potsdamer Platz, but there are closer bus stops with intermittent service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: salsaaudi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about an hour ride as I decided to use the public transport as it was much cheaper. With a taxi it will take around 20 minutes from Schonefeld airport. The hotel is big with many rooms. The staff were efficeint and freindly. The standard room I used was big and extremly clean. The bed was comfortable and the aircondition can be adjusted individually. There was a minibar at the room. The tv-channels were in german but if you wish other channels f.eks. with english languages, you can get it for 5 euros extra per each day. The breakfast was excellent with variety of cold and warm dishes. It costs 25 euros and it is according to my opinion very expensive as the food in Berlin was cheap. I could eat a good dinner with a couple of beers for around 20 euros. The hotel has a pool and a gym which is free of charge for the guests. The bus and underground train services are good and runs 24/7. The taxis are also fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsmith0179
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights due to an in-house congress and was well satisfied with my stay. Check-in smooth, friendly and professional (front staff gave me an upgrade free of charge), the room itself quiet and spotlessly clean although a bit dated. The breakfast buffet was sort of "okish" choice and good quality, service a bit sluggish but overall friendly. Cannot comment on the fitness and pool facilities. All in all a typical business hotel with mostly professional staff. The location of the hotel is close to Potsdamer Platz, thus not the most lively part of Berlin. Would not hesitate to return to or recommend this hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: drcarr74
Reviews.Content: A little far from the attractions but bus stop less than 2 blocks away. Very nice hotel and friendly staff. The bar area is great for a drink in the evening after a long day on the tourist path.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Housebound
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for work. This is a fantastically run hotel. The staff are just so helpful and efficient. The room was very comfortable with gorgeous fluffy pillows and duvets. The bathroom was gleaming. I don't think I have ever seen a bathroom cleaned to this standard. A big thank you to the housekeeping staff for doing such a wonderful job. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, you could literally eat yourself to death there were so many goodies to eat. The only complaint I have is that I was late arriving and I ate in the bar. The bar menu did not have any vegetarian options and I ended up having a very basic salad, basically a plate of lettuce which cost me €12. But apart from this my stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel,friendly and couteous staff”
Reviews.Author: garinks28
Reviews.Content: centrally located,spic span hotel...good food great rooms,value for money...taxi service was there...people in hotel know english and are very helpful..i did not have a charger...the receptionist gave me his ....its a big hotel with 500 rooms...i was staying alone..its very very safe

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spacious, well maintained, well furnished, modern and the staff were helpful and polite. We stayed for 6 nights and found the room to be large, comfortable, clean and well maintained. The hotel is in a quiet area and is on the path of the Embassy walk recommended in the Lonley Planet guide to Berlin. It is also within an easy 15min walk of Potsdamer U & S stations. We did not eat at the hotel as it was expensive, as you would expect with a hotel of this quality, but I would still recommend this hotel as an all round good choice for a city break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Tadgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed there was part of a conference group taking place in the hotel in September. Rooms were perfect, lifts could be busy but the food for breakfast, lunch and dinner was superb on all occasions. It was near the centre but just a bit far to walk into town. However, the area is quite flat and a few of us took bikes to get around. The hotel bar is also quite relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, nice rooms, location okay, large pool”
Reviews.Author: arnsch
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit off, even though it is right in the center of Berlin. Within 10 minutes you can walk to Potzdamer Platz or 20 minutes to department store KaDeWe. The room was nice, good view and quite location. The ministry of defense is right across the street. The size of the hotel surprised me, especially when you walk into the lobby. They have huge conference rooms and the hotel was bursting when I arrived. The pool area is nice - large pool and the pool is open late until 11:30pm, which I found very convenient. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful ! Will come back, especially at this price via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: src_uil
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Maritim for two nights as part of a short business tour . We all found the hotel extremely attractive, warm, comfortable and welcoming. Breakfast was the best buffet I can remember anywhere and was thoroughly enjoyed by all.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Aeonweir
Reviews.Content: I stayed Friday to Sunday so there were less business types around. The hotel is truly four stars in appearance with large comfortable rooms if someone generic. Very quiet. Did try room service and while the food was good and a reasonable portion, with the 3EUR "Service Charge" it was hardly a bargain. It is a great location equidistant between Potsdamer Platz, the Tiergarten and Kurfürstenstrasse BUT it is a good ten minute walk to each of these probably. Unfortunately I expect free Wifi in a 3* and above hotel but like many 4* and 5* Maritim does not have it, so I take a spare SIM card for mobile internet in hotels like this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose-from-the-shires
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this lovely hotel with Riviera Travel. It is obviously popular with business people/conferences etc., but also great for a city holiday break. Ten minute walk from the centre and within easy access of public transport. Hotel is very large, but smart, and very clean. Room was a good size, and quiet, as we were on fifth floor and situated quite a long way from the lift area. The beds were soft and very comfortable (very important to me as I like a soft bed to enable a good nights sleep). Breakfast was superb, with lots of choice. We didn`t have any other meals at hotel, so I can`t comment on quality of these, Staff were extremely obliging, My only small gripe is that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Unfortunately I didn`t get time to use swimming pool etc., but facilities looked very inviting. Overall we were extremely impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Typical upscale business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankTP
Reviews.Content: Nice flagship hotel of this German chain, very posh decorations, a bit 1990s, but still in very good shape and great comfort. I had a mid-size room, which offered a great oopportunity to work. I stayed while visting a conference in the hotel, and their conference facilities are really impressive. Breakfast (included in my rate) was very large and good. Service was very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Financedude
Reviews.Content: Located near Potsdamer Platz (10 min walk) you have an easy access to Berlin. 5 min walk from the Tiergartin (Berlin's big park) and location amongst the Embassy's make it a quiet location also. German efficiency is abundant as well as very helpful staff. The room was nice and clean, although the bed was a bit soft. Great for families , but business travelers will also be welcome.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed every moment”
Reviews.Author: paulinr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week & enjoyed every moment. The rooms were very quiet considering the number of guests on the first night. The breakfast was astounding, I was sorry that I did not like Buck's Fizz. The price of the mini-bar was acceptable considering it was a capital city hotel. Well done Riviera Tours for choosing it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, quite central”
Reviews.Author: valerie_posner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 3 days to attend an exhibition and considering it was full of business people the standard of service was excellent. Usually hotels thaty cater for 200 people in this situation get frustrated and standards drop but this was quite the exception. We ate in the hotel the first night and the food was outstanding. The menu is a little limited but cannot fault the quality of the steak, the service or the general atmosphere at all. The concierge and reception staff were very friendluy and spoke perfect english. Very close to the Sony centre and walking distance to all sites of interest but as this was a business trip did not really have time to explore too much. Would like to return with family and explore Berlin much more as it was very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: legend14
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Maritim Hotel in early afternoon and very quickly checked into our room on the 4th floor. The hotel interior is extremely impressive throughout with very good quality furniture and fittings. The hotel is situated close to the Tiergarten and just minutes from the Potsdamer Platz with the Brandenberg gate and the Reichstag a further 10 minutes walk away. This is a large hotel with over 500 rooms and underground parking for over 400 vehicles. Ther is a definite WOW effect immediately on entering the lobby of the hotel. This also transfers itself throughout the hotels and into the bedrooms. Breakfast is taken in the Maritim Restaurant on the first floor where we found an excellent selection available which ensured an excellent start to our days sightseeing. On our first day we ate lunch in the" Le Bar " which is sited on the ground floor and was a pleasant and relaxing part of the hotel. Fine dining is available in the Grand Restaurant M which is open from 6pm daily. We did however chose to take advantage of the many restaurants available around the potsdamer Platz and also the Sony Centre. Overall this is a very good choice for a hotel stay in Berlin and would highly recommend it. Our only slight disapointment with this hotel is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in our bedroom. We made an approach to reception and made a request for this in our room. The response from reception was - " If it is possible you will get it - if it is not then you wont." In the event we did not receive it. This is in stark contrast to the management response to an earlier review of this hotel. We did otherwise receive excellent customer service throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,shame about the meal”
Reviews.Author: david W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as part of a group tour. Typical business/conference hotel with good facilities.and generous sized rooms. Hotel generally is somewhat soulless & barn like, but spotlessly clean. It is a bit "out of the way" for sightseeing. After a long day out, this, together with the quality of the breakfasts, amongst the best we have come across, resulted in a decision to have dinner in the hotel restaurant. This was a very disappointing (and expensive) experience. There was no problem with the waitress service, but each course took an age to arrive (1-1&1/2 hrs) and the food quality was poor, especially for the price.. We did not finish our main course, and didn't order anything more.There were complaints from several other couples dining at the same time, some walking out , some refusing to pay. The waitresses were visibly upset. All this suggested a "problem in the kitchen" but no apology or explanation was offered. This experience subsequently led us to avoid dining in the Maritim Hotel in Dresden where we stayed for the next two days .

Reviews.Title: “The kind of hotel that starts to grow on you....”
Reviews.Author: boddicker52
Reviews.Content: At first, I was not happy with the location, as it requires a bit of a walk to get to the subway, which could be problematic if it is raining But as long as the weather is nice, the walk is tolerable.. The front desk also emailed me the wrong directions as to what bus to take form the airport, and then didn't respond to a follow-up email I sent. Besides that, I was satisfied. I won the hotel cheaply on Priceline, the internet was free at the business center, and the room was comfortable. I used the pool one night and it was enjoyable. If I come back to Berlin, I would prefer to have a hotel with a location closer to the subway, but I would be okay with this one too.

Reviews.Title: “keep out of the bar”
Reviews.Author: brumex1
Reviews.Content: nice hotel.A little isolated from main square.Very expensive in the bar 6.50 euros for a beer.nice swimming pool.no tea making facilities which i found strange

Reviews.Title: “Large, bit charmless midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foolfin
Reviews.Content: The Maritim Hotel is centrally located and well hidden between quiet public administration buildings and museums. Centrally located means 15-20 min walking distance to many of the main sights and downtown areas of Berlin without however any stores or facilities around the corner. The Maritim being a convention hotel, it shall, like in our case, be congested with convention guests and feel a bit too B2B oriented. The rooms and especially the bar feel slightly outdated although still well maintained. The breakfast offering seems to focus on quantity (of choices) rather than quality. Nice indoor pool for hotel guests to enjoy. Next time a more central location (i.e. 2 mins to stores and restaurants) like Gendarmenmarkt might fit our needs better.

Reviews.Title: “Part business, part pleasure, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dateblogger
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a business conference and stayed over fro a couple of days, very nice rooms, great walk in wet room, very clean, breakfast a bit pricey, but good location near Tiergartenstrasse and ten minutes from Brandenburg gate, the bus tour stop is just around teh corner at Philharmonie.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Hotel..!!! will come back again definitely..”
Reviews.Author: Medoz
Reviews.Content: Simply, Excellent location, in the heart of Berlin, close to most of city attractions by walking. Staff were excellent and very very helpful. room was large, very quite, very clean. food is just excellent, very rich breakfast. if you want to enjoy your trip to Berlin, you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Bus M29-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svein
Reviews.Content: I just like to point out first, th elocation of this hotel was not the best if you like to stay near restaurants, bars, shops and such thing, but if you like to stay in a quiet area, this hotel is suberp. The only way to get around Berlin, is to take the M29 bus from the corner of the short street where this hotel is located, it will take you to Kurfürstendam and further ( some departures ). Or you can walk in the opposite direction and get to Potzdamer platz in 10 - 15 min. Nearby is also the Tiergarten, a quiet large park with lots of nice areas to walk or do jogging in. I have stayed at this hotel 2 times, and I am very impressed how good the rooms are. Everything looks super. Good beds, and nice bathrooms, I missed tea/coffee set in the room. I have both times booked trough Pricelineco.uk and have never payed more than € 60 ( without breakfast) for this excellent ****+ hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotravelling76
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel... stayed here for business. It seems to be very much a conference hotel and as well as ours there seemed to be a few other conferences going on, and a film crew milling about as well. The hotel is very big with lots of open space, but it never felt too busy. Check in/out was quick, efficient and friendly. The rooms were spacious and clean, as was the bathroom with a nice powerful shower and plenty of hot water. Breakfast was buffet style with an incredible choice... hot, cold, fruit, pastries, waffles, cereal, breads... Excellent! All the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel, either for business or leisure, and i'd like to go back to experience more of Berlin instead of just the inside of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: xmerlotx
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, very helpful staff and nice little swimming pool. Thanks to the concierge for recommending the 12 apostles as an alternative dining experience. We loved it! Our son loved the legoland discovery centre at the sony centre. Good activity if its raining and only ten minutes walk from hotel. Fabulous breakfast buffet with great choice of fruit, meat and breads. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: offtoanotherplace
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with clean rooms and within walking distance to many attractions. We were given great recommendations from the concierge. The staff were very helpful, polite, and made the stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong With Maritim!”
Reviews.Author: misisbuccat
Reviews.Content: If you do want to experience luxury at a reasonable price, you cannot go wrong with Maritim. The hotel is conveniently located to tourist attractions, Sony Centre being the nearest, and still maintains its elegance and quiet ambiance. After a day of walking and sightseeing, you just can't miss Maritim's relaxation amenities. The receptionists are a bit grouchy but that's ok. You can expect a long queue to their breakfast buffet but it is worth the wait, I can guarantee you.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, elegant and well-run.”
Reviews.Author: Genussmensch
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is basically just a large hotel catering to conferences, you could feel at home even as a single traveller, particularly over Christmas. The service, beginning from the staff at reception, over to house keeping and the restaurants, is immaculate with a personal touch. Its spacious premises are elegantly modern, well-kept and easy for the handicapped. Food, particuarly the richly laden breakfast buffet, is of the finest. The location is slightly off the beaten track but close to Tiergarten, Embassy row with intriguing modern architecture, the Gemäldegalerie and the Philharmonie.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, comfortable conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: tudomany
Reviews.Content: A large hotel, part of a chain, geared toward accommodating international conferenes and meetings. A good value. My room was quiet and comfortable with a bathroom that included a tub and a makeup mirror. Everything very clean. The staff was friendly and efficient. Everyone spoke some English. A bar at one end of the ground floor and a restaurant with unexceptional food at the other. The big surprise was the huge breakfast buffet, which almost looked like a market. The hotel is several blocks away from the nearest U-Bahn station (Potsdamer-Platz), but only a couple of blocks away from a bus line that runs along the Tiergarten. Two very good art museums are in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse_Lil
Reviews.Content: Friendly efficient check-in; excellent restaurant and lively bar: Comfortable business lounge with wifi and more than adequate breakfast options. Room decor a bit dated but everything clean and comfortable, with wifi and wired internet access; poor choice of TV channels. Situated in diplomatic quarter, about 15 mins' walk from Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11111111
Reviews.Content: The Maritim is in a somewhat hidden location, 10 min walking distance from Potsdamer Platz. It is located across the street from Bendlerblock, the place where Stauffenberg was shot (he was the man who tried to blow up Hitler - the movie Valkyrie was based on his story, for the ones who do not know him). So it is located next to a historic setting. I have only stayed in great hotels in Berlin and the Maritim is no exception. Service is excellent, and so are the rooms, the pool area and breakfast. I ran the Berlin Marathon yesterday and the Maritim was the perfect choice for it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, friendly staff, great service :-)”
Reviews.Author: Truthseeker01
Reviews.Content: While our reservations were not immediately found, staff gave us a complimentary room upgrade. Staff were helpful, welcoming and great with our kids. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, the best I've ever experienced! I will definitely come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “hehehehehe”
Reviews.Author: Youvan
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice......alot of food for breakfast......mmmmmhhhh yummy.......and not so far if you want to go to the city..........cool.................and very friendly staff here..................better for you to try this hotel........not so expensive anyway...................hehehehehe

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: goodytravel
Reviews.Content: 15 min walk to Potsdamerplatz. Initial checkin the staff were very friendly and informative. During our stay there was a heat wave in Berlin, Stayed 2 days, the Airconditioner did not work the first night the staff could not fix it – Manager called and offered next morning free breakfast however when we showed up the next morning the front desk staff – Daniel – claimed he does not know of any free breakfast and was very rude. His argument was that things fail the hotel cannot do anything and we would have to pay for our breakfast. After 20 min argument we left and had breakfast outside. I have prepaid for this hotel hence they did not care if the problems were taken care of. Also during the argument the front desk staff “Sir you paid thru priceline what more would you expect, we cant do anything even if equipment does not work”

Reviews.Title: “Well suited for business travelers - good (small) pool/sauna area”
Reviews.Author: ymff
Reviews.Content: Location: Nothing much in immediate area but plenty of restaurants and activity a short walk away. Parking: Did not use. Check-In: Fast. Elevators: Fast. Room: 6016. Medium sized. Room Lighting: Good lighting. Windows: Windows along one wall. Good blackout curtain. View From Room: Other wing of hotel. Room Cleanliness: Very clean and kept very clean. Bed: Clean. Firm. Pillows were a bit soft. Bathroom: Modern fittings and very good lighting. Several amenities. Bidet. Water pressure strong. Hot water was hot. Water completely stopped one morning while I was in the shower. Turned out someone was doing maintenance but the guests affected were not informed. Surpising sloppiness in an otherwise well run hotel. Room Service: Very fast. Food taste was good. Not too expensive. Desk: Good lighting at desk. Power sockets in wall at desk height. Desk Chair: Just a chair, not adjustable. Phone: One at bed and one at desk. Couch: Two comfy chairs - no couch. Internet: Reliable and not free. Average speed. Safe: Can fit laptop with a little twisting. Drawer Space: Plenty. TV: Smallish, not LCD. Limited Englsh channels. Alarm Clock: No. But good phone wake up system. Iron: None. Robes: Yes. Slippers: Yes. Umbrella: None. Fridge: Minibar fridge has limited space for other items. Drinking Water: Bottled water provided was very expensive. Bought my own. Tea and Coffee: No complimentary tea and coffee. Turn Down Service: No. Air Conditioning: Very efficient. Noise Level In Room: Very quiet. Morning Newspaper At Door: None. Staff: Very friendly and efficient. Breakfast: Plenty of choices at buffet but expensive at 19 euros for continental breakfast. Pool: Small but could do fast short laps. Very clean. Excellent water temperature. Jet in pool. Sauna/Steam Room/Jaccuzi: Good clean Sauna and Steam Room. Wake Up Call: Reliable using phone system. Check Out: Fast. To Airport: Hotel taxi for 20 Euros took 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Rude treatment by female front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: PDubBowie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for about 7 days last summer (09). Although I was disappointed with location (15-minute walk to the Sony Center and 15 minute bus ride to downtown) and the size of the rooms, I thought the lavish buffet was worth the price of the room. However, the afternoon/evening front desk clerk (blonde girl) was incredibly rude and unhelpful. I now management must know about her treatment of "foreigners" (espeically brown foreigners) but appear to do be doing nothing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very business-oriented”
Reviews.Author: BigTim78
Reviews.Content: I normally prefer smaller hotels, but Priceline had an unbeatable price on this place so I couldn't turn it down. Check-in took the longest of my whole trip, about 25 minutes. The hotel itself is very nice, with all the amenities you'd expect from a high-end hotel. I was lost in the shuffle a bit due to a convention going on there, but the staff still did a good job. Nice but pricey bar. Just up the street from the Tiergarten and lots of other sights. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, not much charme but all the services you need”
Reviews.Author: Jacopone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights uring a business tryp. The hotel is very big and host many conferences rooms. It is clearly a business hotel, with many facilities (SPA, restaurants, bar, pool, etc.) but not much charme. I found a bit disappointing that they charge quite a lot for accessing the wi-fi internet connection. Another minus is that TV has just one english channel (CNN) and one french channel, all the others are in German. Considering the price they charge i would expect a better provision of TV channels and free wi-fi connection to the internet. Staff at the front desk is very kind. The hotel is not that easy to reach by public transportation (metro stop is quite far away and you need to take buses), but it can be reached with just a 20-euros taxi ride from the Tegel airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, an Oasis in a fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: lacuadra
Reviews.Content: The rooms were impressive and spacious. The hotel is huge so you may have to walk a little. A full convention hotel but can be wonderful during weekends, like an oasis in Berlin. The hotel is located 10 minute walk to Potzdamer platz and 4 minute walk to a several bus lines. M85 day and N2 all night are the most convenient ones. ( access to Potzdamer platz, Hauptbahnhof, or Ku-Dam street.) So, if you want to walk out and see a bustling street, this is not it. But if you prefer to walk a little bit and come back to a very quiet location and relax, this is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marce_LCh
Reviews.Content: Good things: big room, big bathroom, helpfull staff. Not so good things: small and kind old TV and charge the use of business center Bad things: terrible mattress. You have to walk 12 minutes to get to Postdamer Platz to find the nearest restaurant and U Bahn station but is not that bad. If you walk to the hotel's corner you can take the bus that takes you to Kurfürstendamm that has the best shopping and lots of good restaurants. The buffet is really good but is expensive. We stayed there for the Berlin Marathon and was a really good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Breakfast. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sara-Peters
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an amazing breakfast that you have to try. Customer service for Europe is good (remembering that they aren't as customer service oriented as they are in the states). The hotel is located in an ok place. Its a block (maybe two) from the bus stop and a 10 minute walk to a major subway hub (Potsdam Platz). That area also has restaurants and an underground mall. The plus is that the hotel is located down the street from Tiergarten. You can rent bikes at the hotel for a reasonable rate and bike around the garten and city like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: In_Exile
Reviews.Content: I second what other reviewers have said about the less than convenient location for the general tourist. The hotel actually isn't all that far from Ku'damm and Zoo (by bus) or Potsdamer Platz, but it's not all that close, either. It is close to a few attractions (if you are an art historian or a well-heeled short-term visitor to the Stabi, you might be well housed here). There were bathrobes and slippers, which always make me happy. The bathtub was a decent size. And, there was a bidet. The bath products were hotel-branded generics, nothing great. The room I had was down a long, long hallway, but the payoff was a magnificent-- and I mean, postcard perfect-- view of Potsdamer Platz. An important note: if you want to take advantage of the hotel's truly spectacular breakfast (the spread is really impressive), make sure it's included in your room rate! It is painfully, ridiculously, seriously-how-much-is-breakfast? expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A fish out of water”
Reviews.Author: Fitzcaraldo
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other comments, I stayed here for one night. Arrived by taxi. There are buses within a few hundred yards, but they are not necessarily convenient for visitors who don't know the area. Potsdamer Platz for access to underground trains is a ten minute walk - which was hard work in the fierce morning sun. The surrounding area is very quiet with no local facilities. The hotel itself is good, breakfast is very good and good value. Wifi worked, and you can connect through T-mobile which saves on expensive connection costs, but I don't see why they don't just offer free wifi to guests anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Flawed hotel...inconvenient location.”
Reviews.Author: MarkBrownAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week while attending a conference held at the hotel. For Berlin this is not a particularly inexpensive hotel, but the hotel is well equipped, well maintained and the rooms comfortable. There are some important things to be aware of before staying here, however: 1) the location is NOT convenient. to get to any sort of store or restaurant outside of the hotel, it's at least a 10 minute walk, and this takes you to the almost suburban looking Potsdamer Platz, not one of the nicer parts of Berlin in my view. 2) the wireless internet offered was almost useless. only once in 3 days was I able to download my email. 3) my room (I think 4125) was an incredible walk down multiple hallways after exiting the nearest elevator. I've never experienced anything like it. There weren't even stairs that I could take to avoid the circuitous hike. Be sure to request a room NEAR the elevator. On balance, I think you can do far better in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet, luxury hotel centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler691
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located between the K'damm area and the Postdam area. There is public transportation available within 1 block. The hotel facilities are well maintained, rooms are very comfortable and the location is nice and quiet. The hotel is located in the diplomatic quarter, with many embassies in the neighborhood. The only drawback is that there are no restaurants, bars or stores in the residential area of the hotel. The hotel offers restaurants and bars, however they are fairly expensive. To access stores, bars and restaurants requires a 10 minute walk or 5 minute walk/bus ride to Potsdam area. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful - offering my a map of Berlin at check-in and explaining the hotel's services. Wake-up calls were delivered with German precision and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, disinterested, poor and impersonal service”
Reviews.Author: bendheim
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this business hotel are really great, large, nicely decorated and kept spotlessly clean. But it's also cold and impersonal. There is no coffee facility in the room, and you are just a number in what is a big business hotel. Foolishly, I left some keys and a panama hat there, and despite several calls to the hotel both while still in Berlin and back home, I was met with disinterest and plain unhelpfulness by the staff who just couldn't have cared less. What an arrogant bunch! The location of the hotel is a brisk 10 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz in a quiet and at night deserted area.This is also the location of the nearest tube station. There are no restaurants or street life anywhere closer than this. For my second week in Berlin I was glad to move to the Crowne Plaza..smaller rooms, older, but way friendlier and right near the heart of things a hop and a skip from KaDeWe and K'Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel business but far from everything (restaurants, bars, museums, attraction, public transportation, etc.)”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself is huge, in the middle of a wooded and quiet area. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the services that are proposed (e.g. swimming pool) are nice. Desk staff was nice and efficient. WiFi connectivity is available though T-Mobil with a 1-month subscription rate at 29€ that is OK if you can reuse it. But, apart from the restaurant inside the hotel, there is *nothing* at all in the immediate surroundings. You have to walk empty streets for at least 10 minutes to find a place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business maybe not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: tripsrme
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to attend a medical symposium. Check in quick and efficent despite the volume of co-travellers all checking in together. Lift can only be accessed by swiping room key fob which gives extra security. Luxurious room, very spacious and comfortable. All usual amenities with good toiltetries, bathrobe and slippers. Room safe in wardrobe, mini bar available through exorbitant prices. meals all excellent quality, good variety of freshly prepared cuisine of high standard. Location is a little out of main city centre, though walked to Brandenburg gate in about 15mins. Appears to be very much a conference hotel, and is geared up to accomodate large volumes of participants, though this may put off leisuer travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chasse13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a business trip to Berlin. Location is not as bad as some posts would suggest - 5 minutes walk to Potsdamer Platz and 15 minutes to Brandenburg Gate. Hotel itself is very nicely done. Yes it's a conference venue, but I'd rather have the buzz of people using the lobby than to have piped muzak in an empty space. The rooms are very nice and well-equipped. The breakfast is (as others have noted) excellent. The staff were all very helpful and polite. If you stay here then you should definitely use the spa and pool.

Reviews.Title: “A big conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: agl120854
Reviews.Content: A huge business hotel, where as others wrote the conference took up the whole lobby (they moved the furniture out) so there was no place to sit in the lobby. It was convenient for the IPA conference that was held there, but unless one was attending a conference there I cant see any reason to stay there. Other than the art museum across the street which is fantastic the location is not great. There are no restaurants within a 10 minute walk. Potsdammer Platz is a 10 - 15 minute walk. A plus: Breakfast was great with tons of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasOrchid
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel with large group of business associates from the U.S. Although we were in Germany for a business meeting, the time in Berlin was for pleasure so we did not use the conference facilities. The guest rooms are fairly spacious by German standards and provided exceptionally good hanging space, drawer and cabinet space and counter space in the bathroom. The hotel is slightly off the beaten path in the embassy district, but is within two blocks of the beautiful Tiergarten park and within a few blocks of the shopping area at Sony Center. We made a 30 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe (within 30 minutes or less of the hotel, but you'll want to spend much more time touring the area). The breakfast at the hotel is well above average and the service was efficient and courteous on the four mornings that we enjoyed the expansive breakfast buffet. Walk all the way through to the back of the dining room where you will find a quieter, smaller buffet, non-smoking tables and a lovely view of the surrounding streets. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The breakfasts tip the balance!”
Reviews.Author: Phil M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a conference, which is just what the hotel is designed for. Service at reception was friendlier than previous reviews indicate and they coped very well with the last morning rush as all delegates checked out at same time. The hotel is not quite central, but the 10ish minutes to Potzdammer Platz is fine in good weather. Room looked recently renovated and was spotlessly clean. Breakfast as huge and varied as others have said, but a bit chaotic unless you go early or late. Not the ideal hotel for those who can't or won't walk a bit, but must be great in the summer when Tiergarten (just nearby) is in full swing. All in all deserves more than the two stars given recently.

Reviews.Title: “built for conventions”
Reviews.Author: angmack
Reviews.Content: This is a new, spacious and comfortable hotel. Rooms were fine although most don't have much of a view. Be warned, however, that the spaciousness is because this is a purpose- built conference/exhibition hotel. It is crammed with eager conventioneers and stand designers, installers, tearer-downers etc. But there is so much room that they don't get in the way too much. Breakfast is as huge and varied as reported before; the dining room is good but slow and gets filled very quickly- many disappointed would-be diners turned away, and the only alternative is a bar snack. This huge hotel has no coffee shop or equivalent; so nowhere to eat lunch or dinner other than in this formal (means pricey) dining room. And so it's a good - or not so good in the rain & dark -10 minutes walk to the Potsdamer Platz , home to many eateries. That's also the nearest U-bahn - although we found a bus stop nearer at the Concert Hall- so your cab costs will mount up in bad weather. Basically this place is not designed for individual travellers' requirements. But it's a high standard for the mass business market, and in a nice part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: dianews
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my husband who was attending a conference in September 2006. Beautiful hotel, great breakfast, very nice room and bathroom. 3 minute walk from bus stop - 10 minute journey into Berlin on very efficient, clean buses. Only fault was that staff were not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel, but some thns nees improovement”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: The interior and the main hall are very imposant and big. The staff could be more friendly and the elevators do not work properly. But the breakfast buffet ist exceptionell very good. If your company pays you may stay here - but for holiday it is to expensive and too far away from metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a businessperson's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: While new with very comfortable beds and a fresh feel to it the hotel is a long way from being ideal for business. Among the flaws I noted during my stay in March 2006 were: - The elevators frequently missed floors and caused delays, particularly during the peak breakfast period of 8:30 to 10 AM - Long wait for taxis during the above time frame. It is also not possible to just walk on to a main road to look for a cab as the nearest busy intersection is a 10 minute walk - The Gym/Fitness room is an apology for one - One treadmill, one elliptical trainer and one stationary bicycle! There is no other cardio equipment = the shower stalls in the bathrooms,while expensively finished, lacked a soap tray! The hotel also has very long corridors and a room at the end means a very long walk to the lifts. Also rather oddly,for an expensive hotel, they use paper napkins in the breakfast area

Reviews.Title: “A perfect buisiness hotel - also good for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Matzchik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply overwhelming. The only negative thing: It is really, really big. Expect long walks to reach your room. But that might be an excellent exercise after the overwhelming breakfast.... I have traveled a lot in my life - but I never found such a big choice for breakfast. Even fruits I have never ever seen before. Everything fresh and of top quality. The rooms have a very special atmosphere with their furniture in the style of the 1920s and 1930s - everything in real, massive wood. Warm colours, plenty of light. Bathrobes and free slippers even in the standard rooms... The hotel is located in the diplomatic quarter of Berlin. The embassies of Austria, South Africa, India and Egypt as well as the German Ministry of Defense are very quiet neighbours. The city center with the famous "Potsdamer Platz" is within walking distance. Nice swimming pool and sauna. A very cozy bar with one of Europe's most famous barkeepers. There is plenty of staff, and they are soo friendly. I arrived with only one small travel bag, but a young lady insisted to carry it to my room (did I mention the long floors?) The conference facilities are simply perfect. I stayed there for a buisiness conference, but if I could afford it, I would definately come back for leisure as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Maritim Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Stauffenbergstrasse 26, 10785 Berlin, Germany
